alert.note: Alert for Judith Basin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 07 at 6:56PM MST until March 07 at 8:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Judith Basin County in central Montana... * Until 800 PM MST. * At 655 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located over Judith Basin county, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes Highway 200 between mile markers 10 and 61. Locations impacted include... Stanford, Hobson, Geyser, Raynesford, Windham, Moccasin, Ackley Lake State Park, Sapphire Village, Utica and Benchland. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.
